results.title: Food
results.brief_description: An animated film, without commentary, produced by a guest filmmaker from India, Gopal K. Gokhale, during a period of workstudy at the National Film Board. The film is intended to demonstrate to farm audiences in developing countries how improved farming practices and technology increase crop yield and income. Film without words.

results.title: Fonteyn and Nureyev: The perfect partnership
results.creator_credit: Peter Batty and Peter Batty Productions
results.brief_description: Narrated by Robert Powell, this is the remarkable story of the unique dancing collaboration of Margot Fonteyn and Rudolph Nureyev that brought joy to millions around the world. Thought by many to be the most sensational partnership ever, it is certainly one against which all others will be judged. Theirs was a collaboration of two very contrasting personalities. Fonteyn, an experienced ballerina, idolized already for her own achievements and for whom stardom seemed an effortless progression. Nureyev, half her age and relatively unknown, had to thrust his way into a dancing career against the advice of family and friends. This wonderful voyage through their careers together is filled with the opinions and reminisces of the friends and contemporaries and some rare and intimate footage of the perfect partners. It includes performances from the ballets; Romeo and Juliet, Le Corsaire, Giselle, Swan Lake, Marguerite and Armand, Les Sylphides, Birthday Offering, Hamlet Prelude and Lucifer.

results.title: Fontane Effi Briest = Effi Briest
results.creator_credit: Tango Film, Filverlag der Authoren and Rainer Werner Fassbinder
results.brief_description: Possibly Fassbinder’s most exquisite film, this is the story of a seventeen year old girl stifled in a loveless marriage, too naive to understand that her liaison with one of her husband’s friends risks bringing disaster on both of them. Using carefully stylised visuals and performances, Fassbinder produces not a conventional literary adaptation but a searching study of the ways that people can unwittingly conspire in their own downfall. From the novel by Theodor Fontane. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Fong Sai Yuk = The Legend
results.creator_credit: Eastern Production Company and Yuen Kwai
results.brief_description: In order to win favour with the villagers, local official Tiger Lei proposes a kung-fu championship with his beautiful daughter, Ting Ting’s hand in marriage as the prize. His wife, a champion martial arts practitioner will provide the competition, and the footage of the fight sequences played out on scaffolding is truly amazing. Unbeknownst to her father, Ting Ting has fallen in love with Fong Sai Yuk (Jet Li), who defended her honour, won her heart, and earned the wrath of those he defeated in protecting her. Sai Yuk enters the contest, unaware he is duelling to win the girl he loves, and throws the fight when he mistakenly identifies a family servant as the intended bride. Sai Yuk’s mother, mortified at her son’s defeat, skilled in martial arts and willing to challenge the mores of society enters the competition disguised as Sai Yuk’s brother, wins the contest, as well as the adoration of the woman she defeated. The film culminates in an all out action sequence where identities are revealed, loyalties challenged and amazing skills are displayed. Cast also includes Josephine Siao, Michele Reis and Hu Hui Chang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Fond memories of Cuba [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Frontline Films and David Bradbury
results.brief_description: In this film about life in modern Cuba, documentary filmmaker David Bradbury travels across the country attempting to answer the question of whether Cuba has succeeded as a socialist society, forty years after Fidel Castro’s rise to power. “Fond memories of Cuba” is a telling testament to the daily struggle for survival for the inhabitants of Cuba, many of who lament their lot in life. The film depicts a decayed country that thrives on music and culture but is incapacitated financially and crippled by the US embargo. Despite many positive reviews, Bradbury was critiqued for imposing onto this project his disillusionment with Cuba and pre-ordained notion of a society in peril, which he then sought to confirm via this work. Essentially a collection of interviews, “Fond memories of Cuba” also features many street scenes including arrests that depict police brutality. This work is interspersed with archival footage of the 1960s revolution and pre-revolution political situation, which includes discussion of the role of Che Guevara during those times. As well as a document that teases out questions of politics and society, the film also serves as a fascinating travelogue of the country’s natural beauty and enduring culture. In English and Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Following their footsteps
results.brief_description: The small towns of Kernot and Grantville in south-eastern Victoria, depend on volunteer emergency services to ensure that when fires break out, car accidents happen or cats are stuck in trees, that someone is there to help. Who better to have on call than local legend Barrie Stewart and the dedicated members of the Kernot/Grantville CFA.

results.title: Following the plough
results.brief_description: A tour of contemporary Canadian agriculture led by a modern troubador whose work on the land moves him to song. What is seen is farming as big business coast-to-coast, mechanised, automated, where the farmer is businessman, scientist, world citizen, but still a man with a desire for independence and his own place on the land.

results.title: Follow you follow me
results.brief_description: Examines the complexities in the friendship of two teenage boys - one a shy thirteen year old whose father owns a factory, and the other a confident extrovert whose father is an employee and shop steward at this same factory. An industrial dispute directly affects this friendship and the intensity of their feelings is revealed.

results.title: Follow the leader
results.brief_description: A supervisory training film which makes use of puppets. Designed to increase employee pride in and identification with the organisation. It also aims to make employees understand and be proud of their job and their skill at performing it.

results.title: Follow the fleet
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Pandro S. Berman and Mark Sandrich
results.brief_description: Based on Hubert Osborne’s play “Shore leave”, this romantic comedy musical features that wonderful dancing duo, Fred Astaire as Bake Baker, a sailor, and Ginger Rogers as Sherry Martin, a dance-hall hostess. Although playing more of a supportive role to Randolph Scott and Harriet Hilliard, the Fred and Ginger team put in an unforgettable performance with “Let’s face the music and dance”. Cast also includes Betty Grable and Lucille Ball. Lyrics and music by Irving Berlin.
